title: 5,000 Subscribers and a New Way to Support Slow AI
subtitle: Five thousand subscribers, a paywall-free commitment, and the introduction of bespoke poetry.
author: Dr Sam Illingworth
content_html:
I did not expect Slow AI to reach 5,000 subscribers by December. Starting this project in July felt like an experiment in shouting into a very loud, very fast room. This growth is a humbling reminder that many of you also feel the need to slow down and interrogate our relationship with AI.

Slow AI is a space for reflection. All posts are free. Paid subscribers support the work and receive bespoke poetry.

Slow AI will always prioritise accessibility.

Everything I post will remain free for everyone.

I value the time you spend reading these pieces, and I have no intention of placing that dialogue behind a paywall.

However, maintaining this level of independent analysis requires time and resources. In order to do this whilst keeping everything free I am now offering a more personal incentive for those who wish to support the project through paid subscriptions.

Poetry.

If you choose to contribute financially, I will write a bespoke poem for you. Hopefully, these poems will serve as a both an exchange of payment and as a necessary, human friction against the automated outputs we encounter daily.

To celebrate this milestone, and as an early Christmas present, here is a poem that I have written for all of you, as a thank you for helping to build this community with me.

A Child Explains AI to Their Grandparent

It’s like a brain
but flat
they say,
with no skull to keep it warm.
You talk to it
and it answers,
but it doesn’t
really
know.
Like when you smile
at the man in the shop
even though
you don’t remember his name
It’s clever,
but sometimes
gets the cat’s name wrong
or thinks you live
in Canada.
Can it love?
you ask.
The child shrugs.
It depends on
what you mean
by love.

Go Slow.

Sam
